item.description: Once again, a macOS point update has stalled on my old MacBook Pro. It has been stuck for nearly 8 hours. I guess I will force reboot (later) and cross my fingers that it comes back to life.
Hot take: Swift 4.1 is .1 better than Swift 4.

It‚Äôs a big Apple software update day today! iOS 11.3 and Xcode 9.3 finally were released. I hope the new Xcode works out more of the Swift-related kinks. Xcode 9.2 still can‚Äôt jump to many of my method definitions, and I‚Äôve never understood why.
There‚Äôs nothing quite like learning new T-SQL commands. I‚Äôm learning more about window functions, such as LAST VALUE today. The reason? Messed up data that we are dealing with.

I just signed up for the Git Tower Version 2 Public Beta. I‚Äôm not sure if I want to pay so much for a Git client (after the beta expires), when SourceTree is free, but SourceTree has been so buggy recently I am getting sick of it.

I am fixing more bugs in my iOS app this week. The bugs are mostly related to navigating a table view via the keyboard. It worked better under the iOS 10 SDK. It‚Äôs pretty clear that Apple cares very little about full hardware keyboard support on iOS. It can be awesome, though.

Presuming I trade in my iPad Air 2, the new iPad looks pretty compelling to me. I‚Äôm not sure it is worth giving up the non-glare coated, fully laminated display, however. I do feel like the Air 2 only has about one good year left in it, and 1-2 not so good years after that.
Do any Micro Bloggers host their own RSS feed reader back-end? I‚Äôve been curious about Tiny Tiny RSS and other competitors over the years, but I‚Äôm not sure it is worth it.

item.title: üéµ Max Richter's "Sleep"
item.description: I am unreasonably excited to learn about Max Richter‚Äôs 8 1/2 hour album ‚ÄúSleep‚Äù. It is meant to be played all night long, as you sleep. What I have heard so far is quiet, relaxing, and beautiful. I doubt my wife would let us play it through the night while we sleep. But maybe we could play it instead of white noise for our kids.

I‚Äôm not so good at Micro Monday recommendations for whatever reason, but I do try to reach out to people on the platform and provide help, kindness, support, and encouragement on a regular basis. Small kindnesses do make a difference to people, both in person and online.

üé≠ Last night my wife and I saw ‚ÄúMotown: The Musical‚Äù. We enjoyed it but thought it was too sanitized and limited in viewpoint to be interesting. I would have liked to hear more (any?) complete songs. The music is fantastic, of course. We‚Äôll be listening to those records today.
SwiftoDo 2.11.0 is now available in the App Store. It adds a URL scheme to add task (x-callback-url), a network activity indicator, and fixes a major hanging bug.
üéô I missed Om Malik‚Äôs spot-on take on Facebook from February, before the Cambridge Analytics fiasco. It‚Äôs worth a listen if you‚Äôre still interested in the Facebook mess.

The main reason that I still have my Facebook account is that potential employers view people without Facebook accounts as weird. Unfair, I know. I just don‚Äôt use it anymore. Whatever data I surrendered to them is already lost, so deleting my account won‚Äôt make much difference.

item.title: üé¨ Rewatching ‚ÄúThe Last Jedi‚Äù
item.description: I am enjoying ‚ÄúThe Last Jedi‚Äù a lot more on the second viewing. I didn‚Äôt like it when I first saw it in the theatre, for a dozen different reasons. But now I get it in a way I hadn‚Äôt. Some things I thought were annoying, like Po‚Äôs actions, were supposed to be. The whole movie is about learning from failure, and is well structured around that theme.

üéµ I‚Äôm trying to form an opinion of The Decemberists‚Äô new album, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Be Your Girl‚Äù. I haven‚Äôt gotten my mind around it quite yet. Has it really been 7 years since ‚ÄúThe King Is Dead‚Äù!?
üéô ‚ÄúThe Menu Bar‚Äù is a surprisingly good podcast. Episode 8 shifts drastically from contrarian Apple/tech topics to an interview with director Alex Proyas. Great stuff!
SwiftoDo 2.10.1 is now available in the App Store. It adds tons of hardware keyboard shortcuts and fixes some bugs.
I kicked my Twitter addiction this year, but how do I kick my Google News addiction? It is a frequent time waster for me. Deleting my bookmark to it didn‚Äôt help.
SwiftoDo 2.10.0 is now available in the App Store. It changes how the Postpone function works, improves network connectivity warnings, and fixes bugs.

item.title: The Nest temperature sensor
item.description: I wanted a remote temperature sensor for my Nest six years ago. I‚Äôve lived too long without it to feel like it is necessary now. The Nest has not noticeably improved since I got it. The best thing I did with it is set it up with Homebridge to use with Siri. It works faster and more reliably through that hack than through the official iOS and watchOS apps. I wish Nest, the company, had done better with it, but they seem to have lost interest in their initial product years ago.
Correction: Excel is making me hurt today.
I am making Excel hurt today.

item.title: üìΩÔ∏è Justice League
item.description: üìΩÔ∏è I saw ‚ÄúJustice League‚Äù last night and really enjoyed it. I had very low expectations, due to its grim, overly macho preview and predecessor. I‚Äôm a comic book fan, though, and ‚ÄúJustice League‚Äù felt like the sort of story i‚Äôve seen many times before, but, of course, filmed in live action with tons of special effects. I thought that the film did have problems, but it was obviously made for comic book fans‚Äîwho have read and seen the save-the-world story many times before, and want to see an even bigger version of it‚Äîand it succeeded more than all the negative reviews suggested. Yes, I could quibble about a dozen things, and I think the movie would have been even better with just Wonder Woman, Batman, and Superman in it, but I enjoyed it quite a bit, and hope they make a sequel in a couple years.

Raspberry Pi‚Äôs new model is an unexpected Pi Day treat. I use two older Pis as specialized servers in my home: one for Homebridge and one for Pi-hole. They are inexpensive and amazing. I‚Äôm not sure I will get the new one, though‚ÄîI need even faster network speeds.
Happy Pi Day, everyone! I told my daughter to tell her kindergarten class that this morning, and she was very perplexed. I guess I need to teach her geometry. üòÄ

Stephen Hawking‚Äôs death was the first notable death since 2009 that I did not learn first about on Twitter. I‚Äôm relying on The NY Times and WaPo for news now. I didn‚Äôt have to figure out from hearsay and later research who it was and whether it was true.

I feel like hardly any apps use the iOS 11 Files app integration that Apple introduced last year. Google searches haven‚Äôt yielded much information on any limitations of the API that are of interest to me. I guess I have to try to do what I want and see if it works.
The third nor‚Äôeaster in three weeks has screwed up our plans yet again.

item.title: Apple buying Texture
item.description: Apple buying Texture is interesting and unexpected to me. I subscribed to Texture for a couple weeks and did not like it because I found it too hard to read on my iPad and iPhone. Basically, for most of the magazines it offers, it provides you images of magazines, with their crazy layouts and scads of advertisements, rather than access to the magazine‚Äôs website content. It was like reading a PDF rather than a webpage. The small text size, traditional print magazine layout, and the need to pan around the page made the reading experience very poor. Since it looked good, I am not sure if Apple will spend much time improving it, even though it was impossible to use.
I realized this morning that what I was coding last night was an implementation of the Strategy pattern. And I thought I had just made it up myself. üòÇ
My son has figured out how to turn on the flashlight of my Apple Watch. No wonder battery life took a hit lately. üòÄ
My wife let me sleep in today. üôèüòÄüëç‚ù§Ô∏è
Blog post: My slide into audiophile territory, Part 2‚ÄîWhat does it mean, to me, to be an audiophile?
üéµ I have become a huge Lana Del Rey fan recently. I can‚Äôt get enough of her lushly produced dream pop. (Maybe I‚Äôm depressed or something. üòÇ)
Blog post: SwiftoDo Development Notes, March 2018
Based on the MacBook Pro keyboard-related gripes of Daniel Jalkut and the guys on the ATP podcast, I‚Äôm considering buying an iMac instead of a new MacBook Pro next year. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

üéµ ‚ÄúIf I had my time again‚Äù is my favorite song from Tim Minchin‚Äôs ‚ÄúGroundhog Day‚Äù musical. I love how it flips the premise of the show on its head for a bit and lets the female lead shine.
SwiftoDo 2.9.2 is now available in the App Store. It adds a filter option for prioritized or non-prioritized tasks, optimizes app startup, and fixes some minor bugs.
Thundersnow!
Judging by the nearly mashed-up news headlines, I think that The Weather Channel missed an opportunity to name today‚Äôs storm ‚ÄúWinter Stormy Daniels‚Äù.

Swift, multi-threading, closures, callbacks, and UI-blocking alert controllers are colliding in unexpected ways and kicking my ass this week. I‚Äôm stashing my latest bug fix, which isn‚Äôt finished, and building a new SwiftoDo release from my prior commit.
Google Voice‚Äôs voicemail transcriptions can be chilling sometimes.

I have to create dozens of Active Directory user accounts on a domain controller today, and the PowerShell cmdlets to help with that are somehow not installed. Time to get some ‚òïÔ∏è and power through it.

My daughter has trouble falling asleep. This past week she has started to complain about noise outside. It turns out you can hear airplane noise from her room constantly. We live 30 miles from the airport, so this is a bit surprising to me. I wonder if flight paths have been changed or something.
Hi, @orionp. I heard your interview on The Omni Show. You are a very interesting fellow!

We all survived the six hour blackout tonight. It was cold but we were able to get pizza delivered and to spend a couple hours with nearby friends how have a generator. Still, we are grateful for lights and a warm house.
I actually solved a user‚Äôs problem with my iOS app today by asking ‚Äúhave you tried turning it off and on again?‚Äù üòÖ.

SwiftoDo 2.9.1 is now available in the App Store. It fixes a longstanding Dropbox-related bug that caused a crash on startup for some users. Bonus feature: the task editor now recognizes new projects and contexts and adds them to their respective pickers.

This is the best explanation I‚Äôve found for why Excel outputs my graph series in the opposite order I want them, every time I create a sideways bar chart. It‚Äôs an insane default. Typical Microsoft brutalist design!
